intro: Allophylus samarensis, commonly known as the Samarensis Allophylus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in lowland forest areas and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
